words.definition: Lasting for a very short time; transient and fleeting in nature.
words.example: The beauty of cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few weeks each spring.

words.definition: The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
words.example: Finding that rare book at the garage sale was pure serendipity.

words.definition: Present, appearing, or found everywhere; omnipresent.
words.example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

words.definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing; clearly expressing feelings.
words.example: Her eloquent speech moved the entire audience to tears.

words.definition: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
words.example: The resilient community rebuilt after the devastating earthquake.

words.definition: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a practical way.
words.example: We need a pragmatic approach to solve this complex problem.

words.definition: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something.
words.example: She felt ambivalent about moving to a new city for work.

words.definition: Well-meaning and kindly; characterized by doing good.
words.example: The benevolent donor funded scholarships for underprivileged students.

words.definition: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
words.example: The cacophony of car horns in rush hour was deafening.

words.definition: Having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties.
words.example: Her diligent efforts paid off when she graduated with honors.

words.definition: Deriving ideas or style from a diverse range of sources.
words.example: Her eclectic taste in music ranged from classical to hip-hop.

words.definition: Very attentive to accuracy and detail; meticulous.
words.example: He was fastidious about keeping his workspace organized.

words.definition: Fond of company; sociable and outgoing.
words.example: His gregarious nature made him popular at social gatherings.

words.definition: A system in which members are ranked according to status or authority.
words.example: The corporate hierarchy determines the chain of command.

words.definition: To light up or make clear and easier to understand.
words.example: The teacher's explanation helped illuminate the complex concept.

words.definition: To place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
words.example: The artist juxtaposed light and dark colors to create drama.

words.definition: Relating to or resulting from motion.
words.example: Kinetic energy increases with the speed of an object.

words.definition: Affected by lethargy; sluggish and apathetic.
words.example: After the heavy meal, he felt lethargic and wanted to nap.

words.definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
words.example: Her meticulous research ensured the accuracy of the report.

words.definition: Feeling or showing a longing for the past.
words.example: Looking at old photographs made her feel nostalgic.

words.definition: No longer produced or used; out of date.
words.example: Floppy disks became obsolete with the advent of USB drives.

words.definition: A seemingly contradictory statement that may nonetheless be true.
words.example: The paradox of choice suggests that more options can lead to less satisfaction.

words.definition: Attractively unusual or old-fashioned.
words.example: The quaint village had cobblestone streets and thatched cottages.

words.definition: Given, felt, or done in return; mutual.
words.example: Their friendship was based on reciprocal respect and trust.

words.definition: So delicate or precise as to be difficult to analyze or describe.
words.example: There was a subtle hint of sarcasm in her voice.

words.definition: Perceptible by touch; clear and definite; real.
words.example: We need tangible evidence to support your claims.

words.definition: Never done or known before; without previous instance.
words.example: The pandemic created unprecedented challenges for businesses.

words.definition: Using or expressed in more words than are needed.
words.example: His verbose writing style made the article difficult to read.

words.definition: Playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing way.
words.example: The children's book featured whimsical illustrations of talking animals.

words.definition: The highest point reached by a celestial body; the peak.
words.example: The empire reached its zenith during the reign of Emperor Marcus.

words.definition: A very large quantity of something; plentifulness.
words.example: The garden produced an abundance of fresh vegetables.

words.definition: Concise and exact use of words in writing or speech.
words.example: The brevity of his speech was appreciated by the audience.

words.definition: Truthful and straightforward; frank.
words.example: I appreciate your candid feedback on my presentation.

words.definition: Very fine in texture or structure; easily broken or damaged.
words.example: Handle the delicate glassware with care.

words.definition: The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
words.example: Good teachers show empathy toward their struggling students.

words.definition: Able to express oneself easily and articulately.
words.example: She is fluent in three languages.

words.definition: Truly what something is said to be; authentic.
words.example: Her genuine smile made everyone feel welcome.

words.definition: Having or showing a modest estimate of one's importance.
words.example: Despite his success, he remained humble and approachable.

words.definition: Extremely large or great, especially in scale or degree.
words.example: The project required an immense amount of work.

words.definition: Cheerful and friendly; good-humored.
words.example: His jovial personality made him popular at parties.

words.definition: Having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm.
words.example: She has a keen interest in environmental issues.

words.definition: Expressed clearly; easy to understand.
words.example: Her lucid explanation made the complex topic understandable.

words.definition: Extremely beautiful, elaborate, or impressive.
words.example: The palace was a magnificent example of baroque architecture.

words.definition: A subtle difference in meaning or opinion; a shade of meaning.
words.example: Understanding the nuances of the language takes years of practice.

words.definition: Hopeful and confident about the future.
words.example: She remained optimistic despite the challenges ahead.

words.definition: Continue firmly in an action despite difficulty or opposition.
words.example: If you persist in your studies, you will eventually succeed.

words.definition: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality.
words.example: Paris is the quintessential romantic city.

words.definition: Sending out light; shining or glowing brightly.
words.example: The bride looked radiant on her wedding day.

words.definition: Calm, peaceful, and untroubled; tranquil.
words.example: The lake was serene in the early morning light.

words.definition: Not readily letting go of; firm or obstinate.
words.example: Her tenacious spirit helped her overcome many obstacles.

words.definition: Being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else.
words.example: Each snowflake has a unique pattern.

words.definition: Full of energy and enthusiasm; bright and striking.
words.example: The city has a vibrant nightlife and cultural scene.

words.definition: Feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems.
words.example: Be wary of strangers offering unsolicited help.

words.definition: Produce or provide; give way to pressure or demands.
words.example: The orchard yields a large harvest of apples each year.

words.definition: Great energy or enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or objective.
words.example: She pursued her goals with tremendous zeal.

words.definition: Having or showing clear and effective use of language.
words.example: He gave an articulate presentation of his research findings.

words.definition: Completely puzzled or confused; perplexed.
words.example: She looked bewildered by the unexpected turn of events.

words.definition: Logical and consistent; easy to understand.
words.example: She presented a coherent argument for the new policy.

words.definition: Having normal physical functions suspended or slowed down; inactive.
words.example: The volcano has been dormant for centuries.

words.definition: Difficult to find, catch, or achieve; evasive.
words.example: Success remained elusive despite his best efforts.

words.definition: Sparing or economical with regard to money or food.
words.example: His frugal lifestyle allowed him to save money for the future.

words.definition: The quality of being thankful; readiness to show appreciation.
words.example: She expressed her gratitude for their support during difficult times.

words.definition: Forming a pleasing or consistent whole; melodious.
words.example: The team worked in harmonious collaboration.

words.definition: In accordance with the highest standards; faultless.
words.example: Her impeccable manners impressed everyone at the dinner.

words.definition: Having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense.
words.example: Making judicious decisions requires careful consideration.

words.definition: Blood relationship; a feeling of being close to someone.
words.example: They felt a strong kinship despite being from different countries.

words.definition: Giving off light; bright or shining, especially in the dark.
words.example: The stars were luminous in the clear night sky.

words.definition: Lacking interest or excitement; dull; routine.
words.example: He was bored with the mundane tasks of daily life.

words.definition: Feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed.
words.example: He gave a nonchalant shrug when asked about the controversy.

words.definition: Ostentatiously rich and luxurious or lavish.
words.example: The opulent mansion featured marble floors and crystal chandeliers.

words.definition: Engaged in, involving, or reflecting deep or serious thought.
words.example: She sat in pensive silence, contemplating her future.

words.definition: A state of perplexity or uncertainty; a difficult situation.
words.example: She was in a quandary about which job offer to accept.

words.definition: A close and harmonious relationship in which people understand each other.
words.example: The teacher quickly established rapport with her students.

words.definition: Briefly and clearly expressed; concise.
words.example: His succinct summary captured the essence of the lengthy report.

words.definition: Free from disturbance; calm and peaceful.
words.example: The tranquil waters of the lake reflected the mountains.

words.definition: Fully in agreement; with the agreement of all people involved.
words.example: The committee reached a unanimous decision on the proposal.

words.definition: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
words.example: She is a versatile athlete who excels in multiple sports.

words.definition: The quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment.
words.example: Age brings wisdom and perspective on life's challenges.

words.definition: A feeling of intense longing for something.
words.example: She felt a deep yearning for her homeland.

words.definition: Having or showing zeal; fervent and enthusiastic.
words.example: The zealous volunteers worked tirelessly on the campaign.

words.definition: A person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause.
words.example: She is a strong advocate for environmental protection.

words.definition: Noisy, energetic, and cheerful; rowdy.
words.example: The boisterous children played loudly in the playground.

words.definition: Sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings of others.
words.example: The nurse showed great compassion toward her patients.

words.definition: Having the ability to make decisions quickly and effectively.
words.example: A decisive leader is needed during times of crisis.

words.definition: Involving many carefully arranged parts or details; detailed.
words.example: They created an elaborate plan for the surprise party.

words.definition: Inspiring fear or respect through being impressively powerful.
words.example: They faced a formidable opponent in the championship match.

words.definition: Courteous, kind, and pleasant, especially toward inferiors.
words.example: The gracious host made everyone feel welcome at the party.

words.definition: Create difficulties resulting in delay or obstruction.
words.example: Bad weather hindered the rescue efforts.

words.definition: Featuring new methods; advanced and original.
words.example: The company is known for its innovative products.

words.definition: Show or prove to be right or reasonable.
words.example: Can you justify your decision to quit your job?

words.definition: To light or set on fire; to arouse or inspire an emotion.
words.example: Her speech kindled hope in the hearts of the audience.

words.definition: Conforming to the law or to rules; valid and acceptable.
words.example: He raised legitimate concerns about the project.

words.definition: Lacking in quantity or quality; insufficient.
words.example: They survived on meager rations during the harsh winter.

words.definition: Showing a lack of experience, wisdom, or judgment.
words.example: It was naive of him to trust the stranger so quickly.

words.definition: No longer produced or used; out of date.
words.example: Many jobs have become obsolete due to automation.

words.definition: Strange or odd; unusual.
words.example: There was a peculiar smell coming from the basement.

words.definition: The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.
words.example: The team showed remarkable resilience after their initial setback.

words.definition: Performed or occurring as a result of sudden impulse; unplanned.
words.example: Their spontaneous road trip became a memorable adventure.

words.definition: To grow or develop well; to prosper and flourish.
words.example: Plants thrive in sunny, well-watered conditions.

words.definition: Strong, healthy, and full of energy.
words.example: Regular vigorous exercise is essential for good health.

words.definition: The art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing.
words.example: The candidate's rhetoric was impressive but lacked substance.

words.definition: Tending to stir up conflict; inflammatory.
words.example: The politician's incendiary remarks sparked protests.

words.definition: A tiny trace or spark; a minute particle.
words.example: There wasn't a scintilla of evidence to support the claim.

words.definition: Sweet and soothing; pleasant to hear.
words.example: The dulcet tones of the violin filled the hall.

words.definition: The state of being prosperous; success and wealth.
words.example: The nation enjoyed a period of unprecedented prosperity.
